channeldata.description: symopt makes it easy to define and solve (non)linear constrained optimization problems in Python. It uses the power of SymPy (https://www.sympy.org/) to automate the error-prone and time-consuming task of writing functions to evaluate an optimization problem's objective function and nonlinear constraints (to say nothing of their first and second derivatives!). symopt then provides a standardized interface to solve the problem through nonlinear optimization backends including SciPy (https://www.scipy.org) and Ipopt (https://projects.coin-or.org/Ipopt).
channeldata.summary: Easy (non)linear optimization in Python with symbolically-defined objectives/constraints
